meanings.definition: To give a title or right to something.
meanings.sent1: She intitled the book with a beautiful cover page.
meanings.sent2: The author intitled his latest work 'The Mystery of the Missing Key'.
meanings.sent3: The librarian intitled the shelves with colorful labels.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work intitled her to the top prize.
meanings.sent5: The certificate intitled him to attend the exclusive event.

meanings.definition: To provide with a title or name.
meanings.sent2: The teacher intitled each student's project with their name.
meanings.sent3: The chef intitled the dish 'Spicy Surprise'.
meanings.sent4: The star athlete was intitled 'Player of the Year'.
meanings.sent5: The map intitled each landmark for easy navigation.

meanings.definition: To entitle or qualify for something.
meanings.sent1: His hard work intitled him to a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The ticket intitled her to a free meal at the event.
meanings.sent3: Winning the contest intitled them to a cash prize.
meanings.sent4: The membership intitled her to exclusive benefits.
meanings.sent5: Completing the course intitled him to a certificate of achievement.
